@@ -75,6 +75,8 @@ class ApplicationDraft < ApplicationRecord
   belongs_to :updater, class_name: 'User'
   belongs_to :project1, class_name: 'Project'
   belongs_to :project2, class_name: 'Project'
+  has_many   :application_draft_work_weeks
body:
Hm, I fear I don't get the benefits of this approach 🙈 

It appears rather complex / overly complex to me for what we want to archive: have working-weeks set to either "full time" or "half time".

An more lightweight approach would for instance be: add a new integer column `work_weeks`to the `application_draft` model, make it an [Rails enum](http://api.rubyonrails.org/classes/ActiveRecord/Enum.html) (defined with hash syntax at best) and add the respective translations for it and use a simple select in the form.

Or even simpler: make it a string column and use something like [this gem](https://github.com/makandra/assignable_values) to restrict the values and get the naming right.
